intro: Aulacolepis treutleri subsp. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese starwort, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
